com.vernalis.knime.mmp

Class MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vernalis.knime.mmp.MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser>

    public class MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser>

    Takes a multi-component smiles string, with n+1 components. 1 component must have n attachment point and the other n components only 1 attachment point.

    The parser implements comparable, and sorting is as follows:

    1. Sorted by increasing number of cuts
    2. Sorted by the canonicalised SMILES

    Author:
    s.roughley <knime@vernalis.com>

    • Constructor Detail

      • MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser

        public MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser(java.lang.String smiles)
                                   throws MoleculeFragmentationException
        Constructor. The supplied SMILES string is parsed to a fragment value and key and stored in a canonicalised form. If the SMILES is a 2 component, then the first is treated as the key and the second as the value, and the reverse can be obtained using the getReverse() method
        Parameters:
        smiles - The SMILES string to parse
        Throws:
        MoleculeFragmentationException - Thrown if the SMILES is not a valid fragmentation

      • getReverse

        public MulticomponentSmilesFragmentParser getReverse()
                                              throws MoleculeFragmentationException
        Returns the reverse key/value pair for a single cut fragmentation
        Returns:
        null if not a single cut, or the reverse key/value pair
        Throws:
        MoleculeFragmentationException - If the reversal cannot be processed
